title: Bangladesh-US bilateral defence dialogue begins in Dhaka
body: The two-day Bangladesh-US Bilateral Defence Dialogue began today at the Armed Forces Division in Dhaka, marking the 12th round of discussions between the two nations since the dialogue's inception in 2012. According to a press release from the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR), the talks are significant for strengthening defence collaboration between Bangladesh and the United States. Discussions will cover a wide range of issues, including global and regional security, defence technology and equipment, disaster management, peacekeeping operations, training, inspections, joint exercises, and workshops. The Bangladesh delegation is led by Brig Gen Muhammad Ali Haider Siddiqui, Director General of the Operations and Plans Directorate of the Armed Forces Division, while the US delegation is headed by Brigadier General Sarah Russ. Senior officials from Bangladesh's Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Border Guard Bangladesh, Bangladesh Coast Guard, and other agencies are also participating in the dialogue.
